lead_paragraph: WASCH--Susan Beck, died peacefully at her home in Middletown, CT on February 5, 2016. Daughter of the late Madeline Childress Beck and T. Edmund Beck, she was born in Mt. Vernon, NY on May 20, 1935. She graduated from the Masters School in Dobbs Ferry, NY in 1953. She met her husband-to-be, William K. Wasch, at church and they married in Scarsdale in 1958. In 1964 they moved to Middletown, CT where Bill began his career in Wesleyan's Alumni office. This was the start of a long relationship with the university. In Middletown, she was an energetic member of The Church of the Holy Trinity, the Literary Club and the Middletown Garden Club. She was a passionate advocate of women's education as a 65 year old Ada Comstock Scholar at Smith College, and as a trustee of the Masters School. In her last decade, she and Bill focused their energy on the creation of the Wasch Center for Retired Faculty at Wesleyan. She was inducted into the American Platform Tennis Association Hall of Fame in 1996 for her many national championships, most significantly with her mother and her brother John. Susan was known for her bright smile, her quiet faith, her generosity, and her tenacious love and support of her family. She is survived by her husband William Karl Wasch, her four children: Christina Eleanor Wasch of Middletown, CT, William Karl Wasch Jr. of Munich, Germany, Heidi Helm Wasch of Seattle, WA, and Frederick Childress Wasch of Pennington, NJ. She also leaves behind six grandchildren and her older brother Thaddeus Edmund Beck, Jr. of Glasgow, VA. Visiting hours will be held at Doolittle Funeral Home, 14 Old Church Street, Middletown, CT on February 12th from 5-7pm. A memorial service is being planned for early May. In lieu of flowers, donations may be made to The Church of the Holy Trinity; to the Wasch Center for Retired Faculty at Wesleyan University; or to the Susan B. Wasch Riverfront Development Fund of the Middletown Garden Club, c/o Robert Rickenback, 275 Blue Rd, Middletown, CT 06457. To share memories or send condolences to the Wasch family, please visit www.doolittlefuneral service.com. 1/3
